Here are some possible consequences of a nuclear war:

1. Extensive loss of life: A large-scale nuclear war could result in the deaths of tens or even hundreds of millions of people, depending on the number and size of the bombs involved.

2. Environmental devastation: Nuclear explosions would cause widespread destruction to both natural and human-made environments. This includes forests, bodies of water, and entire cities being leveled.

3. Fallout & radiation poisoning: Radioactive fallout from nuclear blasts could contaminate vast areas with hazardous particles that can lead to long-term health problems for those exposed.

4. Climate change & other atmospheric effects: A "nuclear winter" (cooling effect caused by soot kicked up when multiple cities burn in a short period) may happen as smoke block sunlight causing global surface temperatures to drop significantly for several years.This may have significant impact on agricultural production leading food scarcity

5.Public health crises & diseases : Weakened medical infrastructure due to bombardments combined with mass displacement make it difficult to treat survivors causing increased spread in infections/diseases 

6.Economic collapse - With major industry centres destroyed countries wouldn't be able  which will stagnate economies around the world especially countries reliant on badly affected ones .

7.Psychological trauma- The lasting stress induced from witnessing such an event would have lifelong psychological impacts , something similar like 'shell shock' happening post WWII . 

8.Breakdown societal order - An unstable atmosphere caused  may lead certain regions/groups breaking off into more chaos-causing factions due urgent need survival necessities.
 
9.International instability since lots associated international systems run via superpowers who'd face worst impact thus creating power vacuum globally
